articles.title: Medical Cannabis for Chronic Non-Cancer Pain
articles.subtitle: Systematic Review & Meta-Analysis (BMJ, 2021)

evidence.shortStatement: Small to very small improvements in pain and sleep, with increased short-term adverse events.

keyTakeaways.title: Effect Size Small
keyTakeaways.body: Average improvements are statistically significant but clinically modest.

keyTakeaways.title: Side Effects More Common
keyTakeaways.body: Sedation, dizziness and GI symptoms were more frequent than placebo.

blocks.markdown: This BMJ meta-analysis evaluated randomized trials of non-inhaled cannabis products for chronic pain. The authors found small improvements in pain and physical functioning compared with placebo.

sources.title: Medical cannabis or cannabinoids for chronic non-cancer pain

evidence.shortStatement: THC-dominant products show modest benefit but increased adverse events.

keyTakeaways.title: Product Profile Matters
keyTakeaways.body: THC-rich formulations show more effect but also more harms.

blocks.markdown: This review categorized cannabis products by THC/CBD ratio and compared clinical outcomes in chronic pain populations.

evidence.shortStatement: CBD significantly reduced convulsive seizure frequency compared with placebo.

keyTakeaways.title: High-Level Evidence
keyTakeaways.body: Randomized placebo-controlled trial design strengthens conclusions.

blocks.markdown: In this landmark trial, cannabidiol reduced seizure frequency in patients with Dravet syndrome compared with placebo.

sources.title: Trial of Cannabidiol for Drug-Resistant Seizures in the Dravet Syndrome

evidence.shortStatement: Moderate-quality evidence for certain indications; short-term adverse events common.

keyTakeaways.title: Broad Evidence Overview
keyTakeaways.body: Assessed multiple indications including pain and spasticity.

blocks.markdown: This large meta-analysis evaluated cannabinoids across multiple therapeutic indications and assessed overall benefit-risk profiles.

sources.title: Cannabinoids for Medical Use: A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis
